principle_title: PRINCIPLES SETTING THE CONTEXT FOR EU ACTIONS ON INTEROPERABILITY
criterion_title: The specification has been included in a national catalogue from a Member State whose NIF is fully aligned with at least 4 out of 5 sections of the EIF according to NIFO factsheets.
The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
A public review is part of the decision-making process.
The specification is available for everyone to study.
The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis.
The specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis.
The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
The specification has a strong support from at least one developer community.
The specification fosters the visibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
The specification fosters the comprehensibility of administrative rules, data, services and decision-making of a public administration.
The specification helps to ensure the availability of interfaces with internal information systems of a public administration.
The specification is reusable beyond the domain for which it was originally developed.
The specification has been made available for its reuse by the organisations, administrations, open communities, etc. that developed it.
The specification is available for free on at least one national or European platform.
The specification is independent of any specific technology and/or platform.
The specification is proportionate to the needs of its users (citizens, businesses or administrations).
The specification fosters data portability between systems and applications supporting the implementation and evolution of European public.

principle_title: PRINCIPLES RELATED TO GENERIC USER NEEDS AND EXPECTATIONS
criterion_title: The specification eases the implementation of the once-only principle.

principle_title: PRINCIPLES RELATED TO GENERIC USER NEEDS AND EXPECTATIONS
criterion_title: The specification fosters e-accessibility.

principle_title: PRINCIPLES RELATED TO GENERIC USER NEEDS AND EXPECTATIONS
criterion_title: The specification fosters the secure and trustworthy data exchange between citizens and businesses, and public administrations.

principle_title: PRINCIPLES RELATED TO GENERIC USER NEEDS AND EXPECTATIONS
criterion_title: The specification fosters the delivery of multilingual European public services.

principle_title: FOUNDATION PRINCIPLES FOR COOPERATION AMONG PUBLIC ADMINISTRATIONS
criterion_title: The adoption of the specification reduces the administrative burden.

principle_title: FOUNDATION PRINCIPLES FOR COOPERATION AMONG PUBLIC ADMINISTRATIONS
criterion_title: The specification fosters the long-term preservation of electronic records and other kinds of information.

principle_title: FOUNDATION PRINCIPLES FOR COOPERATION AMONG PUBLIC ADMINISTRATIONS
criterion_title: There are already existing studies or documentation assessing the specification in terms of effectiveness and efficiency.
The specification can be mapped to the European Interoperability Reference Architecture (EIRA).
Mechanisms to assess conformity of the implementations of the specification (e.g. conformity tests, certifications) are available for free.
The specification is recommended by an EU Member State.
The specification has been selected for its use in an EU cross-border project or initiative after agreed identification and assessment.
The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at national level.
The specification is included in a catalogue of standards at EU level.
The specification is included in an interoperability agreement established between organisations involved in European public service provision.
The specification is compliant with a European standardisation regulation (e.g. regulation 1025/2012 on European standardisation).
The specification is a commonly accepted business process modelling specification.
The specification defines organisational interoperability aspects (e.g. skills, language, etc.).
The specification defines a cross-sector reusable data model.
The specification fosters the publication of data as Linked Open Data.
The specification facilitates the publication of public data as open data.
All stakeholders have the opportunity to contribute to the development of the specification
A public review is part of the decision-making process.
The specification is available for everyone to study.
The specification is licensed on a (F)RAND basis.
The specification is licensed on a royalty-free basis.
The specification is sufficiently mature for its use in the development of products and services.
The specification has sufficient market acceptance for its use in the development of products and services.
The specification fosters the creation of innovative solutions.
